templates.name: React + Vite
templates.description: Simple, fast React app with Vite - perfect for basic projects and prototypes

useCases: Basic web apps without backend complexity

ai.systemPromptAddition:
This is a simple React + Vite project - the default for basic applications.

**Key Patterns:**
- Pure client-side React application
- No backend or API needed
- Fast development with Vite HMR
- TypeScript for type safety
- Tailwind CSS for styling

**Directory Structure:**
- src/ - React components and logic
- src/components/ - Reusable components
- src/App.tsx - Main application component

**When to use:**
- Simple UIs without server-side logic
- Prototypes and demos
- Learning projects
- Any basic React application

**When NOT to use:**
- Need authentication or database (use Next.js)
- Need static site generation (use Astro)

templates.name: Next.js 15 Full-Stack
templates.description: Modern full-stack with App Router, TypeScript, Tailwind, and shadcn/ui

useCases: Full-stack web applications with server and client rendering
SaaS products requiring authentication and APIs
examples: Build a todo app with authentication
Build a SaaS landing page with pricing
Build an admin panel with user management

ai.systemPromptAddition:
This is a Next.js 15 App Router project.

**Key Patterns:**
- Use Server Components by default (no 'use client' needed)
- Add 'use client' ONLY when needed (useState, useEffect, event handlers)
- API routes: app/api/[route]/route.ts with export async function GET/POST
- Use TypeScript import type for type-only imports
- Tailwind for styling with utility classes
- shadcn/ui components are pre-installed in components/ui/

**Directory Structure:**
- app/ - App Router pages and layouts
- components/ - Shared React components
- lib/ - Utilities, types, helpers

**After template is downloaded:**
1. Install dependencies: cd {projectName} && pnpm install
2. Components are ready to use: import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
3. Create new pages in app/ directory
includedFeatures: shadcn/ui components (Button, Card, Input, Select, etc.)
Root layout with metadata and fonts

templates.name: TanStack Start (Blank)
templates.description: Minimal TanStack Start + React + Tailwind scaffold for full-stack applications. Provides TanStack Router/Query wiring without opinionated auth or database layers.

useCases: Teams standardizing on TanStack Start for new full-stack builds
Projects that need file-based routing with TanStack Router and server-side loaders
React 19 applications targeting modern SSR/edge runtimes
Internal tools that will layer in auth, data, and APIs incrementally
Proof-of-concept apps exploring the TanStack Start workflow
examples: Kick off a TanStack Start full-stack project with custom backend
Prototype a dashboard using TanStack Router and Query
Create a React 19 + Tailwind admin shell with server-rendered routes
Start a multi-step workflow using TanStack Start loaders/actions
Experiment with TanStack Start SSR on a blank canvas

ai.systemPromptAddition:
This is a TanStack Start project built on React 19 with TanStack Router, TanStack Query, and Tailwind CSS. It is intentionally minimal so you can layer in auth, database, and domain logic.

**Key Patterns:**
- Define routes, loaders, and actions in `app/routes/` using TanStack Start conventions
- Use TanStack Query for client data fetching; prefer server loaders for initial data
- Tailwind CSS is preconfigured for styling; bring your own component library if needed
- The template ships without auth/database; you are expected to scaffold these as part of the build

**Directory Structure:**
- app/routes/ - File-based routes with loaders/actions
- app/components/ - Shared UI components
- app/lib/ - Utilities/helpers you create

**When to use:**
- You want a clean TanStack Start foundation without extra opinions
- Building full-stack React apps that will add custom data/auth layers
- Exploring TanStack Router/Query workflows end-to-end

**When NOT to use:**
- Prefer an opinionated Next.js App Router experience
- Need a static-only marketing site (use Astro)
- Want a minimal SPA without SSR (use React + Vite)
includedFeatures: TanStack Query integration hooked into React 19 defaults
Tailwind CSS configured out of the box
pnpm workspace setup with Vite dev tooling

templates.name: Astro Static Site
templates.description: Fast static site with optional React islands for interactivity

useCases: Sites prioritizing performance and load times
examples: Build a personal blog with posts
Create a marketing site with blog

ai.systemPromptAddition:
This is an Astro static site generator project. **Key Patterns:** - Pages are .astro files with --- frontmatter at the top - File-based routing in src/pages/ (index.astro = homepage) - Use layouts in src/layouts/ for consistent page structure - Add React islands for interactivity: - Content collections for blog posts/docs in src/content/ **CRITICAL: Code Snippet Handling for Deployments:** - ALWAYS use to properly fence code snippets - This prevents code from breaking during deployment builds - Never use regular {code} for multi-line or complex code snippets - Example: **Example .astro page:** ```astro --- import Layout from '../layouts/Layout.astro' const title = 'My Page' ---

{title}

Static content, ultra fast!

 ``` **For interactivity, use React islands:** ```astro --- import Counter from '../components/Counter.tsx' --- ```
